description: [Vanguard] Arguably, the United States of America is having one of its keenest presidential elections ever. Ahead of the conclusion of voting, today, former President Donald Trump of the Republican Party, and Vice President Kamala Harris of the Democratic Party, as of the time of filing this report, were locked in a very tight race.
title: Africa: US Presidential Poll - Trump, Harris in Dead Heat

description: [This Day] Beloved TV personality and seasoned entertainer Tony Okungbowa is set to make a much-anticipated return to the African TV scene as the host of the new season of Kids Say the Darndest Things Africa. Produced by What Studios and Mansa Studios, the show returns with fresh energy, capturing the spontaneous humor, innocence, and wisdom of children across the continent. With Tony's magnetic presence and authentic connection to both guests and viewers, this season promises to elevate the heartwarming and
title: Africa: Okungbowa Returns to Host a Brand New Season of 'Kids Say the Darndest Things Africa' to Drive Family Entertainment Across the Continent

description: [This Day] The recruitment process is rigorous and transparent
title: Africa: A Consequential Presidential Election

description: [Premium Times] Pawstudios Africa is a pioneering incubator hub that elevates African storytelling and creativity through diverse arts and culture programmes.
title: Africa: Aftermath Festival Management Residency Programme, Pawstudios Africa Set for 'Lagos Fringe 2024'

description: [Seychelles News Agency] The Friedrich Naumann Foundation for Freedom (FNF Africa) announced recently that Seychelles' President Wavel Ramkalawan will receive this year's Africa Freedom Prize in a ceremony that will take place on November 6 in Johannesburg, South Africa.
title: Africa: Seychelles' President to Receive Africa Freedom Prize

description: [New Era] We have seen seismic political changes in both South Africa and Botswana, some of which were projected, others that came as a surprise even to the then-incumbent and succeeding regimes.
title: Africa: We Are Namibia, Not South Africa Nor Botswana

description: [The Point] Poor sanitation and high-risk hygiene behaviors confine the poor in a vicious cycle of poor health, environmental degradation, malnutrition, reduced productivity and loss of incomes. For women and adolescent girls, the lack of privacy and dignity has deleterious impacts on health and safety, self-esteem, education and well-being.
title: Africa: Sanitation and Hygiene in Africa!

description: [The Herald] As Africa was recovering from the Covid- 19 pandemic that threatened to cripple economies, many countries in the region have been hit by Mpox.
title: Africa: One Health Approach Helps Combat Zoonotic Diseases in Africa

description: [Daily Trust] Jumia, Nigeria's leading e-commerce platform, has announced the launch of Black Friday campaign, running from November 1st to November 30th.
title: Africa: Online Shopping to Reach $75bn in Africa - Jumia

description: [The Conversation Africa] Progress at the UN's biodiversity summit, Cop16, in Cali, Colombia, has been slow. Frustratingly so.
title: Africa: COP16 - the World's Largest Meeting to Save Nature Has Ended With No Clear Path Ahead

description: [Business Day Africa] A potential victory for former U.S. President Donald Trump in this election could leave African countries at a critical moment, as the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) is set to expire next year.
title: Africa: Trump Win Could Jeopardise Agoa Renewal, Putting Africa At a Crossroads

description: [The Conversation Africa] Sub-Saharan Africa's population is growing at 2.7% per year and is expected to reach two billion by the year 2050. The region's urban population is growing even faster: it was at 533 million in 2023, a 3.85% increase from 2022.
title: Africa: Food Security in Africa - Managing Water Will Be Vital in a Rapidly Growing Region

description: [Nile Post] The African Council of Religious Leaders Religions for Peace (ACRL-RFP) and the Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) have jointly called for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan and emphasised the need for inclusive peace talks.
title: Africa: Religious Leaders Call for Immediate Ceasefire in Sudan Amid Regional Conflict

description: [allAfrica] Cape Town -- "We are gathering to celebrate African innovators who are developing innovations that heal our planet, create local jobs, and safeguard our communities."
title: Africa: African Innovators Poised to Heal the Planet and Drive Local Economies, Says Wanjira Mathai

description: [Daily Trust] A newly released report by the British Deputy High Commission in Nigeria has shown that with just one high-quality refinery for minerals such as lithium, nickel, manganese and copper, Africa could generate an additional $6.8 billion in annual revenues and create approximately 3,500 good quality jobs operating in the battery supply chain.
title: Africa: Africa to Generate $6.8bn Annually With Refineries for Lithium, Nickel, Others - Report

description: [The Conversation Africa] We're increasingly aware of how misinformation can influence elections. About 73% of Americans report seeing misleading election news, and about half struggle to discern what is true or false.
title: Africa: Misinformation Really Does Spread Like a Virus, Suggest Mathematical Models Drawn From Epidemiology

description: [IPS] Cali, Columbia &amp; Delhi -- Small-scale fishers play a fundamental role in feeding people--they use sustainable methods of catching and processing fish products and are a significant force in the employment and livelihoods of millions of people internationally--yet, until now, they have been excluded from climate and biodiversity conferences.
title: Africa: Voices From the Margins - Small-Scale Fishers Demand Rights, Recognition At COP16

description: [MAP] Paris -- Morocco stands today as a leader in terms of infrastructure quality in Africa, Director General of the Moroccan Agency for Investment and Export Development (AMDIE) Ali Seddiki stated.
title: Africa: Amdie Director General Sees in Morocco an Infrastructure Leader in Africa

description: [Daily Maverick] In this Daily Maverick wrap for readers in South Africa, we gives some pointers, expertise and tips about the US elections
title: Africa: US Elections At a Glance - What You Need to Know If You're in South Africa

description: [ACNS] The Bishop of Norwich, Graham Usher, has reflected on the COP 16 Biodiversity Conference, and looks ahead to the COP 29 Climate Conference.
title: Africa: Bishop Graham Usher's Call for Unity in Biodiversity and Climate Action

description: [UN News] A new study by the World Health Organization (WHO) lists 17 bacteria, viruses and parasites that regularly cause disease as top priorities for new vaccine development.
title: Africa: Who Identifies 17 Pathogens As Top Priorities for New Vaccine Development

description: [UN News] The international community must ensure that the global shift from fossil fuels to clean energy is equitable, UN Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed said on Monday in New York.
title: Africa: Green Energy Shift Must Also Bring Prosperity and Equality - UN Deputy Chief

description: [The Conversation Africa] In many countries around the world, wild animals are sometimes killed for food, including monkeys, rats and squirrels.
title: Africa: Stopping Mpox - Wild Meat Markets Are a Root Cause and Must Be Made Safer

description: [The Conversation Africa] As we approach the global annual climate change conference, COP29, the need for increased public finance from the global north to address climate adaptation in Africa has become more urgent than ever.
title: Africa: African Countries Shouldn't Have to Borrow Money to Fix Climate Damage They Never Caused - Economist

description: [The Conversation Africa] Cities are vital engines of economic growth, innovation and social progress. They shape the futures of nations and the lives of millions.
title: Africa: Africa's Cities Are Growing Chaotically Fast, but There's Still Time to Get Things Right - Insights From Experts

description: [ISS] Which of the two countries is better placed to champion Africa's developmental aspirations?
title: Africa: India and China Vie for Leadership of the Global South
